title: EFPT Sardinia 2018 – Update
content: The third EFPT freestyle windsurfing tour stop of the season 2018, the EFPT Culuccia in Porto Liscia, had sufficient wind conditions for 4.8m to 5.2m sails on the kick off day of the event. The top seeded riders qualified for the top 8!update about day 1 90 minutes wind would be enough to complete the single elimination and to know the winner. Day 2 and Day 3 had not enough wind and day 4 doesn’t look too promising. Let’s hope that the final day will bring the conditions. Unfortunately it doesn’t look too promising. Great wind is forecasted for monday… Adam Sims, official video producer of the EFPT and rider,  had a chat with head judge  and multiple EFPT tour winner and PWA Freestyle World Champion Steven van Broeckhoven about the fleet, the level, the favourites, the moves, the progression… here’s the videoupdate about Steven van Broeckhoven’s injury in autumn 2017Questions & answers: Adam Sims has Tom Hartmann and Steven van Broeckhoven on the hot seat The remaining 8 riders in the single elimination are: Loick Spicher Riccardo Marca Julian Wiemar Giovanni Passani Antony Ruenes Steven van Broeckhoven Mattia Fabrizi Tonky Frans Selected action shots by Emanuela Cauli from the EFPT freestyle windsurfing event in the beautiful Porto Liscia, Sardinia 2018 Swiss Loick Spicher feels home at the Culuccia 2018 (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Riccardo Marca, Mr. consistency (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Julian Wiemar, the only German of the fleet (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Antony Ruenes with his unique style (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Steven van Broeckhoven goes big in his heat (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Mattia Fabrizi made the heat high score on day 1 (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) Tonky Frans in full control (Photo: Emanuela Cauli) This might also interest you
